SEARCH
Module com.mc.InventorySystem
Package com.mc.controller

Class NotifyUser

java.lang.Object
com.mc.controller.NotifyUser
public abstract class NotifyUser extends Object
This abstract class contains methods for displaying different types of notifications to the user.
Author:
Michael Cassidy

      Parameters:
      object - the object that could not be deleted

    • notifyNotSelected

      public static void notifyNotSelected(String type, String action)
      Displays a warning message when no object of a certain type is selected.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of object that was not selected
      action - the action the user was attempting to perform

    • notifyNotValid

      public static void notifyNotValid(String content)
      Displays a warning message when input is invalid.
      Parameters:
      content - the content of the warning message

      Displays a confirmation message when an object is successfully modified.
      Parameters:

    • notifySaved

      public static void notifySaved(String type, int id, String name)
      Notifies the user that an object has been successfully saved.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of object that has been saved (e.g. "Part", "Product")
      id - the ID of the saved object
      name - the name of the saved object

    • notifyIntOutOfBounds

      public static void notifyIntOutOfBounds()
      Displays a warning message notifying the user that the integer input is out of bounds. The warning message includes a message informing the user that integer inputs must be between 0 and 999999999.

    • notifyUnableToDeleteAssoPart

      public static void notifyUnableToDeleteAssoPart()
      Displays a warning message indicating that it is unable to delete an associated part.

    • notifyUnableToDeleteProduct

      public static void notifyUnableToDeleteProduct()
      Displays a warning message that the selected product can't be deleted as it still has associated parts attached.

    • notifyPartRemoved

      public static void notifyPartRemoved(Part part)
      Notifies the user that an associated part was successfully removed
      Parameters:
      part - the part that was removed
